meaning_str.bing:
n. 对；一对；一双；分两个相连接部分的物体
v. 配对；交配；使成对；配对（以繁殖）
网络. 对子；一副

对；一对；一双；分两个相连接部分的物体
配对；交配；使成对；配对（以繁殖）

一对；一双；一副；一组；一条（裤子）；一把（剪刀）；两个共事（或有特殊关系）的人；成对；配对；对子
使成对；配对；交配；匹配；使（两人或两物）相配；成双；组合；连接；结伴

1.en: He said the pair will meet the Spanish public two weeks after their arrival, depending on how quickly they adapt to their new surroundings.
1.cn: 他说这对大熊猫将会在抵达后的两个星期与西班牙公众见面，但要也要取决于他们能适应周围新环境的速度。

2.en: If it isn't possible for you to touch the floor, support your hands on a pair of blocks or the seat of a folding chair.
2.cn: 如果不能接触到地板，用瑜伽砖或者一折叠的椅子的座位支撑手。

3.en: Many coastal birds are now getting ready to pair bond, court, and nest, noted the Louisiana Coastal Initiative's Driscoll.
3.cn: 很多滨海鸟类现在正配对、求偶、筑巢，路易斯安娜海岸环保促进会的德里斯科尔指出。

0.en: What was the threat? Clementine. I perceived her to be moving toward a pair of guests with harmful intent.
0.cn: 威胁是什么？克莱门汀，我认为她企图伤害一对游客。

1.en: Here's some other fun news on the Raj/Emily front. He gave her a pair of diamond earrings and leased her a car.
1.cn: 我来爆点杰丽恋的料吧，他送了她一对钻石耳环，还给她租了一辆车。

2.en: I have to pair it with you. Pair what with me?
2.cn: 我得把它跟你配对。把什么跟我配对？

3.en: No, actually, an au pair. Technically, I played an au pair on TV. There's a difference. A lot of people don't know that. I was an au pair.
3.cn: 不，实际上是换工住宿生，准确的说，我在电视上演的是个换工住宿生。这两者是有区别的，很多人都不知道，我饰演的是一个换工住宿生。

4.en: Words to live by, Eggsy. Words to live by. Try a pair.
4.cn: 一生铭记，艾格西，这话要一生铭记着。试试这双。

5.en: You're going to need a pair of shoes to go with your suit.
5.cn: 你需要双鞋子来搭配西装。

6.en: Oh, yes, please. A pair of pants. And my toothbrush. Yeah, and my mail.
6.cn: 拜托你了，带条裤子，我的牙刷，我的信。

7.en: I know who you are, boy. Because you're me. What kind of a pair are we.
7.cn: 因为你跟我一样。咱俩算什么组合啊。

8.en: Poor Peppa. Your shoes were getting a bit old, we'll buy you a new pair!
8.cn: 可怜的佩佩。你的鞋也有一点旧了，我们给你买一双新的！

9.en: I bet if I think about it real hard I could remember my first pair of shoes.
9.cn: 如果我仔细想的话，我能记得我第一双鞋子的模样。

10.en: Oh, come on, grow a pair, Bob. We're giving you what you want. Give us what we want.
10.cn: 拜托，有点胆子，鲍勃。我们都随你的心了，也满足我们一下嘛。

11.en: Echolocation. Oh, like the world's most powerful pair of glasses? What? What are glasses?
11.cn: 传声定位。像是史上最强眼镜吗？什么？什么是眼镜？

12.en: And this color is just stunning. It's a peachy nude color perfect to pair with smoky eyes.
12.cn: 这个颜色看起来好极了。是桃色，与灰色的眼睛很搭配。

13.en: You can't make crotchless panties? You take, you take a pair of scissors and you just cut…
13.cn: 你不会做开洞的内裤？拿一把剪刀给它剪…

14.en: Really? 'Cause this morning at Starbucks, a pair of old underwear fell out of my pant leg.
14.cn: 是吗？今天早上在星巴克一条脏内裤从我裤管里掉了出来。

15.en: When I was little, my mum got me a pair of glittery wellies, and I refused to take them off.
15.cn: 小时候我妈给我买过一双亮闪闪的雨鞋，我都不愿意把它们脱下来。

16.en: And I thought to myself: Wow, you know, I never owned a really good-smelling pair of pants before.
16.cn: 于是我心想，我从来没买过一条很香的皮裤。

17.en: Hey, you leave Marcel out of this. Fine. Have you ever got stuck in a pair of your own leather pants?
17.cn: 别把马修扯进来。好吧，你曾经被自己的皮裤卡住了？

18.en: Honey, isn't it possible that the company that sold the jeans made more than just the one pair? I guess.
18.cn: 卖出那件牛仔裤的公司难道只做了一条牛仔裤吗？我猜你说的对。

19.en: Now I haven't got any shoes to wear. Poor Peppa. Your shoes were getting a bit old, we'll buy you a new pair.
19.cn: 现在我没有鞋子可穿了。可怜的佩琪，你的鞋子确实有点旧了，买双新的吧。
